item.title: 100. Same Tree
item.description: To solve this problem, we need to compare two binary trees, p and q, and determine if they are identical. Two binary trees are identical if they have the same structure and their corresponding nodes have the same value. # O(n) time || O(h) space def is_same_tree(self, p: Optional[TreeNode], q: Optional[TreeNode]) -> bool: if not p and not q: return True if not p or not q or p.val != q.

item.title: 101. Symmetric Tree
item.description: # O(n) time || O(n) space def is_symmetric_rec(self, root: Optional[TreeNode]) -> bool: def is_mirror_tree(node1, node2): if not node1 and not node2: return True if not node1 or not node2 or node1.val != node2.val: return False return is_mirror_tree(node1.left, node2.right) and is_mirror_tree(node1.right, node2.left) return is_mirror_tree(root.left, root.right) # O(n) time || O(n) space def is_symmetric_dfs(self, root: Optional[TreeNode]) -> bool: stack = [(root.left, root.right)] while stack: left, right = stack.pop() if not left and not right: continue if not left or not right or left.
